intro: Oenanthe rigidostriata, commonly known as the rigid-striated water dropwort, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are often finely divided and have a distinct, slightly aromatic scent. Oenanthe rigidostriata typically grows in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and wet meadows.
